Somerset County Public Schools
July 16 at 1:36 PM ·

Lyndi and the rest of our IT Department are hard at work formatting and imaging our 1,500 BRAND NEW H.P. laptops for students in grades 6-12!!!

3rd-5th grade students will be issued our existing school laptops when the year begins, and in October they will be replaced with brand new Chromebooks (they are on back order right now). Pre-k through 2nd grade will be issued Chrome Tablets in October (also on back order).

Thanks to grant funds received from the CARES Act ($1,347,240), our generous County Commissioners ($402,938), and the Governor's Emergency Education Relief Fund ($43,271), SCPS has a device for every student for the 2020-2021 school year! #SmallButMighty #TeamSCPS

Day 61 is complete.

What a mentally draining day! There are those days where we sit and we plan and we talk and it truly taxes your brain! The desire to make change in a positive way has to be matched with the same enthusiasm and passion to make it happen. Just looking at the future and what the it holds for our students, our staff and our community.

The ability to adapt, adjust and move forward is essential no matter what field of study, profession or job you hold.￼ Equally important is the ability to withstand criticism, take the positive from negative situations and take the opportunity to grow every single day.

Education has become like so many other fields, in that everything is rushed, everyone is racing to get out of school, trying to figure out what’s next and plan for what we think lies ahead. In doing so are we missing out on an opportunity to not only impact, but enjoy the day we were given?

#RandomSuperintendentThoughts
#TeamSCPS

While a lot of people thought we would be off today and wished we would have an early day, there was no reason to cancel, delay or early dismiss. We have actually had nor’easter‘s that were far worse than what we got today.

I just look at it as being fortunate that we were not directly impacted by a storm that has caused so much damage and taken human life and it’s not even done yet!

The post tonight is about being thankful for a safe school week and looking forward to a beautiful weekend with family and friends.

I hope everyone gets rested up from the busy week and we look forward to seeing everyone back again bright and early on Monday morning!

#TeamSCPS
#SmallButMighty

post_text:
So Day #2 has ended and it seems like we have been in for a lot longer!! Spent some time at Deal Island Elementary School today. I always enjoy the ride to the school and have a great time talking with the staff and students.

After that it was a couple of updates on the storm and some back to school paperwork. Yes! Yes! We have back to school paperwork that has to be done for the Maryland State Department of Education! This time of year is very busy but always fun catching up with everyone and doing paperwork!

Thank you to WBOC for the coverage of the new technical high school on this evenings news.

Just a reminder to have everyone check this page for official news and information as my other page is now for personal posts only!

Everyone have a great night and we will be in touch!

#TeamSCPS
#SmallButMighty

PLEASE SHARE!!! PLEASE SHARE!!!

This is my yearly weather post and unfortunately it is coming sooner than later!

Any type of delay or cancellation announced on social media will be posted on this page and the Somerset County page. If you see someone else posting that we are delayed or canceled for any reason I would check this page or our county page.

In other words, if it’s not on one of those two pages it’s not true.

As for the hurricane, we are receiving regular updates and I have received great information from Somerset Emergency Services.

The questions have already started about Thursday, September 5. We are running a regular schedule for Thursday the 5th.

As with any situation we take it day by day. Please share and once again if you do not see information about a delay or cancellation on this page and the Somerset County Public School page then it’s not occurring.
